elements.description: The minister disappeared, one night, quite abruptly, with his inner circle and the church's chiefest treasures. He is widely assumed to have gone to a better place: possibly a sunny place beside a shining sea. We could recruit his leaderless flock, and make this our base of operations.

elements.label: Streets Strange by Moonlight
elements.description: Sometimes, the light of the moon is a key to other spaces. I've found a place where, for a night or two, the streets curve in unfamiliar ways. If I walk here, I might find insight, or I might be touched by madness.

elements.label: The Montmerenzi-McDonald Gallery
elements.comments: currently just used for early Ghoul flavour, but we could do more.
elements.description: Alistair Montmerenzi, third and last of the Montmerenzi cartographers, and his enigmatic benefactor Timothy McDonald, collected this small but striking miscellany. After their loss on their final polar expedition, the collection was made available to the public in a blank-faced grey building beside a quiet park... on condition that no piece of art therein was ever to be photographed, nor exposed to daylight.
